channel.title: [C4D] Living Room (new)
channel.description:
I spent all day today reading up on all the settings of VRay, what they do, camera settings etc. And after making several test scenes i decided to try a new room with my own compilation of setup settings. And it came out quite decent and crisp :)
[img]http://fc40.deviantart.com/fs39/f/2008/357/2/9/Living_Room_New_2_by_Frell262.jpg[/img]
Adding fabric bump maps tomorrow, and ill probably do more with the fireplace and table etc. 5am ftw.

item.title: [C4D] Living Room (new)
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:32, topic:251979”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=332711.msg2611785#msg2611785 date=1230790977]

Take out the balls, put something in front of or behind the windows, and up the quality of the render and that would be an excellent render of a house not yet moved into to. The carpet is what sells it. It’s the kind I have in my room and it looks really good in that. Where’d you get it?
[/quote]
Cg textures, usually im worried people will notice im using the same carpet texture any time i use carpet I love the texture to though, i tried making it red but it didn’t turn out to well.

http://www.cgtextures.com/texview2.php?id=8242&PHPSESSID=62e4075efb6a9dcf4c55b261ee581b97&time=1230791238

Ill probably up the hemi subs so i can get rid of all the blotches and it will look clean.[/quote]
that site froze firefox like 20 times

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Living Room (new)
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:37, topic:251979”][quote author=XharveyX link=topic=332711.msg2612725#msg2612725 date=1230843414]
Someone has got to post a tutorial on how to make rooms like this. I would really like to give it a go.
[/quote]

Honestly it’s one of the more simple things I can think of.
It shouldn’t be that way.

It’s just that all the new people go for simplicity and model “representations” of things, not actual things.[/quote]

Another thing is, all new people don’t spend a lot of time modeling things. True the very first model’s like a chess pawn wont take much time but after you get your feet wet and start doing real projects, if you don’t spend a lot of time it wont look good.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Living Room (new)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:35, topic:251979”][quote author=XharveyX link=topic=332711.msg2612725#msg2612725 date=1230843414]
Someone has got to post a tutorial on how to make rooms like this. I would really like to give it a go.
[/quote]

Why? It’s not as if the modeling in the room is that difficult.[/quote]
Modeling the room is simple, but doing the couches/chairs and such is a bit difficult. He probably means just making them look simple and real

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Living Room (new)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Looking at my carpet where my couch meets in my real house, and it doesn’t bend down at all =\ maybe a tiny bit around the legs but nothing noticeable by looking.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Living Room (new)
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

So the legs wouldn’t be directly on top of the carpet, they would be slightly in. And the carpet around it would be bent.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:25, topic:251979”]But it’s not cement carpet.

We have a cement founding and if I were to move my couches around, there would be an imprint.[/quote]
Thats what i mean, the imprints would be filled with the legs.
